name: Bacon Pancakes
ingredients: Melted butter (or neutral oil, like sunflower/canola) - 30 g

directions.title: Preheat the oven and cook bacon
directions.description: Preheat the oven to 200°F. In a large cast-iron or non-stick skillet or on a griddle, cook bacon over medium-high until fat is rendered and bacon is browned on one side, 5 to 6 minutes. Flip and cook until golden and crisp on underside, 1 to 3 minutes.

directions.title: Transfer bacon to paper towels
directions.description: Drain bacon on paper towels; pour off all but 1 teaspoon from skillet (reserve for another use).

directions.title: Combine ingredients to make the batter
directions.description: In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, melted butter, and egg. Whisk flour mixture into buttermilk mixture just until moistened, with small to medium lumps remaining.

directions.title: Heat skiller and cook abcon pancakes
directions.description: Heat skillet over medium heat. Cook pancakes in batches: Space slices of bacon evenly around the skillet, leaving space for pancake batter. Pour 1/4-cupfulls batter over each slice. Cook until some bubbles appear on top of pancakes and a few have burst, about 2 minutes. With a spatula, carefully flip pancakes and cook until browned on underside, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a platter, bacon side up, and loosely tent with foil. Keep pancakes warm in oven and repeat with remaining batter, adding more bacon fat if needed. Serve with pure maple syrup, if desired.

directions.title: Heat up the Dark Honey
directions.description: Put about a cup of dark honey in a small, nonstick skillet on LOW heat. It should be bubbling only a little bit. Stir frequently for 5-10 minutes. Let cool but still warm and liquid.

directions.title: Transfer bacon to paper towels
directions.description: In a separate container, combine lime juice from one lime and cilantro leaves that have been finely chopped. Not much cilantro is needed. You'll have the juice from one lime, then pack as much chopped cilantro as the lime juice will cover, let it sit for 5 minutes, then strain out the cilantro. If you crammed cilantro into a shot glass until full, that would be plenty.

directions.title: Mix
directions.description: Put about 1-2 tablespoons of warm honey into a small microwavable container. Add lime juice and stir. If they do not mix, microwave it for a few seconds and mix again until blended.

directions.title: Chill Mixture
directions.description: Chill this mixture in the fridge. Stir occasionally, it should not separate. The carbonated water should also be chilled. This avoids diluting the flavor if ice is added.

directions.title: Add Soda Water
directions.description: Once they are cold, combine the mixture with 8 oz carbonated water and gently stir. Repeat steps 3-4 with the rest of the honey before it hardens, save for later.

name: Bloom Into You Cheesecake
ingredients: Cookies - 2 cups, crushed (vanilla wafers or graham crackers)

directions.title: Butter and Cookies
directions.description: Melt the butter on low heat, put the cookies into a plastic bag and finely crush them, then combine them with the melted butter.

directions.title: Crust refrigeration
directions.description: Line the bottom of a 9” springform cake pan with parchment paper. Spoon in the mixture, press down with a flat object to spread evenly over the bottom of the pan, Place in the refrigerator to cool.

directions.title: Mix the Batter
directions.description: In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese together with the eggs (Add the eggs one at a time until mixed in), cake flour (to prevent the cake flour from making lumps, pass it through a fine mesh strainer), heavy cream, lemon juice , vanilla and salt.

directions.title: Combine Crust and Batter
directions.description: Remove the crust from the refrigerator and pour the mixture on top and spread evenly across.

directions.title: Bake
directions.description: Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes , reduce the temperature to 300 F and bake for 30 more minutes. Then turn off the heat and leave the cheesecake in the oven for 60 minutes. Let it cool completely.
